threads.com:
/r9k/ is an imageboard where there are no exact reposts.

1. If you attempt to post something unoriginal, it is not posted, and you are muted temporarily.
2. The time with which you are muted for doubles with each transgression.
3. Each mute time is 2^n in seconds where n is the number of times you have transgressed. So, your mute time doubles each time you fuck up.
4. Backlinks, eg >>1, are not viewed by the robot. So "lolwut" and ">>2 lolwut" are the same post, in the eyes of the robot.
5. Gibberish at the end of a post to force originality may result in mod intervention (no BLOX posts please).
6. Images are NOT included in the filter, only text.
7. Your mute count slowly decreases over time.
8. You cannot post a picture without text.
9. Unicode is blocked. Sorry, too many exploits (Cyrillic letters, etc).
10. Posts require a certain minimum amount of original content in order to be posted.
11. Post sane, real content, well thought out replies, and mutes are unlikely.
12. The original algorithm was designed by XKCD:
http://blag.xkcd.com/2008/01/14/robot9000-and-xkcd-signal-attacking-noise-in-chat/

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>71267091
Weight != composition. Ignoring genetic leanings or specific cases like a history of ballooning up and having excess skin, your form is basically a formula of:
>Diet*fitness/notbullshit% = result
If your diet is bullshit (whether you are aware or not) with inaccurate caloric measurements, ""cheat days"", and """"rewards"""", then your progress will be inconsistent. Most people, including those who think they're counting correctly, are doing it wrong because caloric observance is realistically never consistent and truly accurate. Especially if not using a scale and utility like Wolfram Alpha, or if you snack and don't mark shit down, et cetera. As fucking annoying as it is to hear, the results don't lie.

Beyond dietary problems, you also have to consider your fitness lifestyle. What do your daily movements do to contribute to your goal physique? Moreover, do you expect the rate and concentration of your movements to yield your desired result? If they have not happened, is it possible you're not being effective with your fitness? These are things you have to ask yourself.

threads.com: If you want to be happy in life, now and always, just discard anything that is abstract or conceptual, especially that which is social construct. Pay attention only to your own direct experience, what it is you are actually experiencing, perceiving, feeling- not thinking, in every moment. Notice the difference between just thinking thoughts, like "I should be happy" or even "I feel happy" and actually feeling happy in your body. Protip: You can 'hack' the biofeedback loop of your own emotions by adjusting your body language accordingly. It can be as simple as closing your eyes and smiling widely, even a big creepy gin will do, and within a few minutes you will actually feel crazy happy for no reason other than your body responding to the input.
